intro: Cyphostemma spinosopilosum, commonly known as the spiny-haired cyphostemma, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it is often found in rocky or arid habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
